headline: Apple Hardware Executive Says iPhone Maker Plans To Use AI For Speeding Up Custom Chip Design: 'High Potential In Getting More Design Work In Less Time'
summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is reportedly looking to harness the power of generative artificial intelligence to accelerate the development of the custom chips that power its devices, according to senior executive Johny Srouji. What Happened: During a speech in Belgium last month, Apple's senior vice president of hardware technologies, Srouji, said the company is exploring generative AI to streamline chip design, calling it a major productivity opportunity, reported Reuters on Wednesday. headline: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan Keeps Selling This Tech Stock
summary: Intel  CEO Lip-Bu Tan sold another large block of  Credo Technology Group Holding  a provider of high-speed connectivity solutions.  Tan, a Credo director, sold 103,527 shares over June 12 and 13 for a total of $7.8 million, an average price of $75.36 each.  Intel didn’t respond to a request to make Tan available for comment.

headline: Mark Zuckerberg Has Surfed Every Big Tech Wave Hitting Meta’s Shores
summary: Meta Platforms  CEO Mark Zuckerberg has said that Grove “played a big role in shaping my management style.”  Zuckerberg may be the most paranoid person in Silicon Valley.  Zuckerberg, 41, is dedicated to the proposition that Meta should never be disrupted by Grove’s “strategic inflection points,” which occur when a new technology shifts the playing field, exposing incumbents to fresh competition.

raw.headline: Mark Zuckerberg Has Surfed Every Big Tech Wave Hitting Meta’s Shores

headline: 1 Volatile Stock with Impressive Fundamentals and 2 to Be Wary Of
